dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, uh, we've been talking a lot about the coronavirus, obviously, but there's this really developing story, like, a bit of a nightmare scenario, for thousands of people stuck on a cruise ship.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, uh, we've been talking a lot about the coronavirus, obviously, but there's this really developing story, like, a bit of a nightmare scenario, for thousands of people stuck on a cruise ship.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the Westerdam! Yeah, I've seen some headlines about that. What's, um, what's the latest?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the Westerdam! Yeah, I've seen some headlines about that. What's, um, what's the latest?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's pretty wild. After days of uncertainty, and like, mounting joy because they thought they were finally gonna dock, Cambodia has now, uh, denied the MS Westerdam entry. So, they're just... at sea indefinitely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's pretty wild. After days of uncertainty, and like, mounting joy because they thought they were finally gonna dock, Cambodia has now, uh, denied the M S Westerdam entry. So, they're just... at sea indefinitely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It will now dock in Sihanoukville in Cambodia on Thursday, where passengers will disembark over a few day and will be transported to the capital, Phnom Penh, and flown home.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Indefinitely? So, like, no port? Nowhere to go?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Indefinitely? So, like, no port? Nowhere to go?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And this is after Thailand, you know, initially welcomed them, but then later even declined fuel and food. It's just a total reversal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And this is after Thailand, you know, initially welcomed them, but then later even declined fuel and food. It's just a total reversal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Holland America Lines MS Westerdam was banned from docking by Thailand earlier this week...The Thai government on Tuesday offered fuel, food, and medicine to the cruise ship.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And is it because of, like, confirmed cases of coronavirus on board?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And is it because of, like, confirmed cases of coronavirus on board?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Holland America Line, which owns the ship, uh, they *have* confirmed some people have reported symptoms, and they did eventually admit there were confirmed cases. But passengers like Stephen Hansen are saying it's more about fear than facts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Holland America Line, which owns the ship, uh, they have confirmed some people have reported symptoms, and they did eventually admit there were confirmed cases. But passengers like Stephen Hansen are saying it's more about fear than facts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Holland America Line, which is owned by Carnival Cruise, says nobody onboard has reported symptoms...All guests on board are healthy and despite erroneous reports there are no known or suspected cases of coronavirus on board, nor have their ever been.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I can imagine. So, what happens to these 1,500 passengers now? Are they just... paying for this indefinite trip?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I can imagine. So, what happens to these fifteen hundred passengers now? Are they just... paying for this indefinite trip?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Stephen Hansen and his wife are two of the 1,500 passengers stuck on the vessel, which sailed from Hong Kong on February 1st and had been scheduled to end its cruise in Japan on February 15.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Get this: Holland America says they won't pay for flights home, nor will they refund the entire trip.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Get this: Holland America says they won't pay for flights home, nor will they refund the entire trip.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Holland America Line says it will pay for the flight sand refund passengers their entire trip.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's just... [sighs] that's outrageous. I mean, they're literally stuck, um, with no end in sight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's just... that's outrageous. I mean, they're literally stuck, um, with no end in sight.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And itâ€™s not even the only one. Remember the Diamond Princess in Tokyo?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And it's not even the only one. Remember the Diamond Princess in Tokyo?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, the one that was quarantined, like, a thousand people tested positive, I think?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the one that was quarantined, like, a thousand people tested positive, I think?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The British-owned Diamond Princess cruise was quarantined in Tokyo last Monday, with 174 out of the 3,700 passengers on board now ill with the pneumonia-like illness.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, 174 confirmed cases there. And then the World Dream in Hong Kong, also held for days. Cruise ships are really becoming, like, ground zero for these, uh, coronavirus fears.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, one hundred seventy four confirmed cases there. And then the World Dream in Hong Kong, also held for days. Cruise ships are really becoming, like, ground zero for these, uh, coronavirus fears.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The British-owned Diamond Princess cruise was quarantined in Tokyo last Monday, with 174 out of the 3,700 passengers on board now ill with the pneumonia-like illness. Around 3,600 passengers and crew were held aboard the World Dream cruise ship for four days in Hong Kong

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's a really bad look for the industry, you know? And it just highlights how quickly this virus is spreading and impacting everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a really bad look for the industry, you know? And it just highlights how quickly this virus is spreading and impacting everything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. I mean, the numbers are still climbing, right? Over 42,000 infected, over a thousand dead now. And this isn't just about cruise ships, it's shutting down cities, impacting airlines.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. I mean, the numbers are still climbing, right? Over forty two thousand infected, over a thousand dead now. And this isn't just about cruise ships, it's shutting down cities, impacting airlines.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Coronavirus, this week renamed Covid-19, has now killed more than 1,000 people and infected at least 42,000 more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's just a massive, um, global crisis unfolding. And those Westerdam passengers are right in the middle of it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's just a massive, um, global crisis unfolding. And those Westerdam passengers are right in the middle of it.
